AGGRAVATED DAMAGE TO A CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE COMPUTER. Section 1030A of title 18, United States Code, prohibits causing damage to a critical infrastructure computer, resulting in substantial impairment of its operation or associated infrastructure. Violators face fines, imprisonment for up to 20 years, or both. Section 1030 of title 18, United States Code, imposes fines and imprisonment for up to 20 years for violations. It prohibits placing convicted individuals on probation, running imprisonment terms concurrently with other laws, and reducing sentences for separate violations. The section imposes imprisonment for violations, with the option for concurrent sentences for multiple offenses. Definitions for "computer," "damage," and "critical infrastructure" are provided. The text discusses the importance of protecting critical infrastructure assets in the United States to prevent catastrophic effects on public health, safety, economic security, and national security. The text introduces a law to address aggravated damage to critical infrastructure computers and stopping trafficking in botnets.
